summary: WorkflowClient throws a type error when calling the update method on an untyped workflow stub because the workflowType parameter is null for untyped workflows, but the mapUpdateWorkflowResponse method requires a non-nullable string.
userImpact: Users cannot call update methods on untyped workflow stubs without encountering a type error, even though the update is successfully processed by the workflow.
rootCause: The mapUpdateWorkflowResponse method in ResponseToResultMapper has a non-nullable string type hint for the workflowType parameter, but it receives null for untyped workflows.
proposedFix: Change the workflowType parameter in mapUpdateWorkflowResponse from 'string' to '?string' to accept null values for untyped workflows.
resolutionDetails: The workflowType parameter type hint was updated to accept nullable string (?string) to handle untyped workflows.
keyQuote: mapUpdateWorkflowResponse(): Argument #3 ($workflowType) must be of type string, null given
